meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sickly.
meanings.sent1: Her constant sickliness made her miss many days of school.
meanings.sent2: The sickliness of the plant indicated it needed more sunlight.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sickliness, he always had a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The sickliness of the town's economy was evident in the empty stores.
meanings.sent5: The sickliness of the old building was evident in its crumbling walls.

meanings.definition: The tendency to become sick easily.
meanings.sent1: His sickliness meant he caught every cold that went around.
meanings.sent2: The baby's sickliness worried the parents.
meanings.sent3: The sickliness of the cat was a constant source of concern for the vet.
meanings.sent4: The sickliness of the soil made it difficult to grow healthy plants.
meanings.sent5: The sickliness of the water supply led to many cases of illness in the village.
